department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement: NISO Custom Lapel Pins**

# Announcement Details

* Reference Number: PW-MCT-042-6240
* Solicitation Number: 51019-220926/B
* Publication Date: August 19, 2022
* Closing Date: October 6, 2022, 1:00 PM (Eastern Time)

# Contract Information

* Contracting Entity: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* Contracting Entity Address: 11 Laurier Street, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5
* End User: Veterans Affairs Canada
* End User Address: 191 Great George Street, 1st Floor, Charlottetown, PEI C1A 4L2

# Background and Scope of Work

The Government of Canada is seeking a supplier to establish a National Individual Standing Offer (NISO) for Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC) to procure Canada Remembers lapel pins and cards, as well as option to request custom pins and zipper pulls. The estimated usage is 300,000 pins and 50,000 zipper pulls per year.

# Terms and Conditions

* Period of Standing Offer: The standing offer will be valid from the date of issuance to March 31, 2024, with the possibility to extend for an additional three, one-year periods.
* Delivery Requirements: Suppliers must deliver orders of 10,000 units or less within 15 working days, orders of 10,001 to 100,000 units within 7 weeks, and orders over 100,001 units within 10 weeks.

# Tendering Process

* All interested suppliers may submit a bid.
* Suppliers are required to submit their bids in electronic format through the Canadabuy.ca website.
* Bids must be received by October 6, 2022, 1:00 PM (Eastern Time).

# Contact Information

* Contractual Authority: Sonia Stockman, PWGSC, (506) 961-7412, sonia.stockman@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

# Additional Information

* The tender package, including the Request for Proposal (RFP), can be accessed through the Canadabuy.ca website.
* The Government of Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
* All inquiries should be directed to the Contractual Authority.

There are 11 attachments to this tender
